title: A Review of Complementary and Alternative Medicine with a Concentration on Ayurveda Acupuncture and Chiropractic
author: Boyer; Chancellor R
description: 1 broadside. Original designed using Microsoft PowerPoint. 48"W x 36"H
cleaned_text: A Review of Complementary and Alternative Medicine with a Concentration on Ayurveda Acupuncture and Chiropractic Date2017 Author Boyer, Chancellor R. Metadata [Show full item record](/handle/10920/43444?show=full) Abstract This paper investigates the phenomenon of complementary and alternative medicine (CAM) and how various practices within it have continued to flourish despite the preeminence of the Western biomedical tradition. Through a critical analysis of three intentionally chosen CAM systems (ayurveda, acupuncture, and chiropractic) an improved understanding of how they can function as supplemental treatments that encourage a biopsychosocial orientation toward healthcare can be gained.
